content.text: is designed to manage and update account billing records for the New York Power Authority (NYPA). It processes billing data by updating account statuses, handling billing cycles, and managing exchange actions. The procedure ensures that all accounts that should have been billed are accounted for, and it updates records with the correct statuses and adjustments. It also handles the allocation of customer-level adjustments and updates the billing records with exchange data.

The procedure is complex due to its extensive use of conditional logic, multiple updates and inserts, and interactions with several tables. It involves intricate business logic for handling billing cycles, account statuses, and exchange actions, making it challenging to maintain and understand without a deep understanding of the underlying business processes.
: This parameter is used to track which user is executing the procedure, for auditing purposes.
: This output parameter is used to return the execution status of the procedure, indicating success or failure.
: Several local variables are declared and initialized to manage the procedure's flow and store intermediate results.
: The procedure checks if there are original bills for the current processing period and if they have been processed.
: It verifies if all billed accounts have a current period bill. If not, it inserts zero-dollar transactions for accounts without current period transactions.
: Updates account billing records with the correct statuses and adjustments, setting exchange codes to null.
: Updates records with exchange data, marking accounts that have been exchanged.
: Calls another stored procedure to allocate customer-level adjustments.
: Ensure that the tables involved in joins and updates are properly indexed to improve performance, especially given the multiple joins and updates.
: Consider wrapping the procedure in a transaction to ensure atomicity, as multiple updates and inserts leads to inconsistent data if the procedure fails midway.
: If the data volume is large, consider processing in batches to avoid locking issues and reduce transaction log growth.
: The procedure may face concurrency issues if multiple users execute it simultaneously, potentially leading to race conditions or deadlocks.
: Without explicit transaction handling, partial updates could leave the database in an inconsistent state if an error occurs.
: As the data grows, the complexity and number of operations could lead to performance degradation.
: The procedure lacks comprehensive error handling, which could make troubleshooting difficult if issues arise during execution.

--**************************************************************************************
--* Description: Process the NYPA account billing setup. The sequential processing steps needed to
-- Update the Account billing records with the correct account statuses of the existing accounts and the
-- current cycle exchange actions. The exchange code will be set to null.
-- 
-- Determine the active accounts that the utility company did not send a bill for the cycle and add them to the 
-- to the "UploadNYPAAccountBilling" table. At this point, we should have a collection of all of the accounts 
-- that were billed and all of the accounts that should have been billed.
--* Exec: usp_ProcessAccountBillingSetup
--* Parameter(s): 
--*				AuthenticatedUserID int,
--*				StatusCode int output - Execution Return Status 
--* Return:	0 Success
--*			9 Failure
--* AUTHOR: Peter Heller (PAH)
--* Created On: 10/26/2005
--**************************************************************************************
--* Date Tech Description of Change
--* ---------- ---- -------------------------------------------------------------
--* 11/20/2006 PAH Revised to 
--* 03/27/2006 PAH Revised to 
--* 10/26/2005 PAH First Version 
--* 11/23/2018	zd	unique account seq id fix needed here stting
--* 12/14/2018  VY Modified for UniqueAccountSeqID
--* 04/16/2019  zd common.GetUniqueAccountSeqID function is added for update
--***************************************************************************************
CREATE PROCEDURE [Nypa].[usp_ProcessAccountBillingSetup]
(
	@AuthenticatedUserID AS INT,
	@StatusCode AS INT OUTPUT
)
AS
BEGIN
	SET NOCOUNT ON;

	DECLARE @RC int, @InvoiceTrackingSeqid int, @InvoiceUtilityCompanyCoverSheetSeqid INT,
		@UtililtyCompanyCycleParametersExist INT, @BillingCycle varchar(1), @ExhangeCodeNull varchar(2),
		@FromDateParm varchar(1), @ToDateParm varchar(1), @Yes varchar(1), @VoucherAmount MONEY,
		@PostMarkDate varchar(8), @DatePaymentDue varchar(8), @DateAcceptanceIntoOEC varchar(8),
		@BillingPeriod varchar(6), @IsCurrentBillingPeriod INT, @NumberOfOriginalBills INT,
		@NumberOfOriginalBillsProcessed INT, @HasCurrentBillingPeriodBeenProcessed INT,
		@BillingPeriodMismatch INT, @StopCurrentBillingPeriodProcess INT,
		@NumberOfAccountsWithoutCurrentPeriodTransaction INT, @BCAccountStatusInsertCount INT,
		@BCAccountStatusUpdateCount INT;

	SELECT @InvoiceTrackingSeqid = NULL, @BillingCycle = 'M', @FromDateParm = 'F',
		@ToDateParm = 'T', @Yes = 'Y', @BillingPeriodMismatch = 0, @StopCurrentBillingPeriodProcess = 0;

	--	Check Whether it is the current billing and that it has not been already processed
	SELECT @NumberOfOriginalBills = COUNT(*)
	FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling INNER JOIN
		Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
		Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y';

	SELECT
		@NumberOfOriginalBillsProcessed = COUNT(*)
	FROM Billing.AccountBilling INNER JOIN
		Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Billing.AccountBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
		Billing.AccountBilling.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
	WHERE (Billing.AccountBilling.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7) AND 
		(Billing.AccountBilling.CurrentInvoiceAccountBillingGroup = 1) AND 
		(Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y');

	IF((@NumberOfOriginalBills > 0) AND (@NumberOfOriginalBillsProcessed = 0))
	BEGIN
		-- Get the Application current billing period from the ApplicationTimeFrame table
		SELECT @BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod FROM Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame WHERE (CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y')
		-- Verify that all of the accounts that are billed have a current period bill (@NumberOfAccountsWithoutCurrentPeriodTransaction)
		SELECT @NumberOfAccountsWithoutCurrentPeriodTransaction = ISNULL(COUNT(*), 0) from Nypa.uvw_UploadWithoutCurrentPeriodTransactionForAccountBilling
		
		IF(@NumberOfAccountsWithoutCurrentPeriodTransaction<>0)
		BEGIN
			-- Insert current period zero dollars and usage for the next paid adjustment back billing.
			INSERT INTO Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling
				(UtilityCompanyId, 
				AccountBillingGroup, 
				CurrentAccountNumber, 
				PreviousBillingPeriod, 
				BillingPeriod, 
				RevisedBillingPeriod, 
				NextBillingPeriod, 
				BillCreationDate, 
				BillingAction, 
				FromDate, 
				ToDate, 
				ProductionAndDeliveryTariff,
				AuthenticatedUserID,
				AccountStatus,
				AccountPreviousStatus,
				AccountStatusCodePeriod,
				BillingPeriodDays,
				InitialPostingDate,
				LastUpdate)
			SELECT 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.UtilityCompanyId, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.AccountBillingGroup, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod, --Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.PreviousBillingPeriod, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod, --Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod, --Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.NextBillingPeriod, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillCreationDate, 
				'O', -- Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingAction, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.ToDate, -- Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.FromDate, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod+'28', --Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.ToDate, 
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.ProductionAndDeliveryTariff,
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.AuthenticatedUserID,
				'BC', -- AccountStatus,
				'NB', --AccountPreviousStatus,
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod, -- AccountStatusCodePeriod
				0, -- BillingPeriodDays
				getDate(), --InitialPostingDate
				getDate() --LastUpdate
			FROM Nypa.uvw_UploadWithoutCurrentPeriodTransactionForAccountBilling INNER JOIN
				Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling ON 
				Nypa.uvw_UploadWithoutCurrentPeriodTransactionForAccountBilling.MaxRevisedBillingPeriod = Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod
				AND Nypa.uvw_UploadWithoutCurrentPeriodTransactionForAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber = Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber AND
				Nypa.uvw_UploadWithoutCurrentPeriodTransactionForAccountBilling.BillingPeriod = Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod;

			SET @BCAccountStatusInsertCount = @@rowcount;
		END;

		-- Update all of the Account billing records (original and adjustments) with the correct account statuses of the existing accounts and the
		-- current cycle exchange actions. The exchange code will be set to null. Apply the Billing.AccountBillingElectric.CustomerLevelAdjustmentAmount
		-- to the revised billed amount.
		UPDATE Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling
		SET 
			AccountBillingElectricSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingElectric.AccountBillingElectricSeqid, 
			AccountBillingSeqid = Billing.AccountBilling.AccountBillingSeqid,
			CustomerLevelAdjustmentAmount = Billing.AccountBillingElectric.CustomerLevelAdjustmentAmount,
			AccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqid,
			UniqueAccountSeqid = Billing.Account.UniqueAccountSeqid /* added 12/3/2018 */
		FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling
			inner join Billing.Account on Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber = Billing.Account.CurrentAccountNumber
			inner join Billing.AccountBilling on Billing.Account.UniqueAccountSeqid = Billing.accountBilling.UniqueAccountSeqId AND Billing.Account.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' /* added 12/3/2018 */
				and Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod = Billing.AccountBilling.BillingPeriodRevision
			inner join Billing.AccountBillingElectric on Billing.AccountBilling.AccountBillingSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingElectric.MonthlyAccountBillingChargesElectric
			inner join Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame on Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
		WHERE Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y';

		UPDATE Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling
		SET AgencyAccount = Billing.Account.AgencyAccount, 
			AccountSeqid = [Nypa].[GetMaxAccountSequenceId] (Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber,7),
			UniqueAccountSeqID = common.udf_GetUniqueAccountSeqId(Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber), -- added by zd
			AccountStatus = [Nypa].[DetermineBackBilledStatus] (Billing.Account.AccountStatus,'BA',Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod,Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod,Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.AccountBillingSeqid), -- Billing.Account.AccountStatus, 
			AccountPreviousStatus = [Nypa].[DetermineBackBilledStatus] (Billing.Account.AccountPreviousStatus,'NB',Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod,Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod,Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.AccountBillingSeqid), -- Billing.Account.AccountPreviousStatus, 
			AccountStatusCodePeriod = [Nypa].[DetermineBackBilledStatusPeriod] (Billing.Account.AccountStatusCodePeriod,Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod,Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod,Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.AccountBillingSeqid), -- Billing.Account.AccountStatusCodePeriod, 
			BillingPeriodDays = [dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays] (FromDate, ToDate), 
			InitialPostingDate = getDate(),
			LastUpdate = getDate(),
			AuthenticatedUserID = 1, --@AuthenticatedUserID,
			ExhangeCode = null --@ExhangeCodeNull 
		FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling INNER JOIN
			Billing.Account ON Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.UtilityCompanyId = Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider AND 
			Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber INNER JOIN
			Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod 
		WHERE Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y';
			
		--	Update only when the Account Status code 'BC' back billed with no current bill
		UPDATE Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling
		SET AgencyAccount = Billing.Account.AgencyAccount, 
			AccountSeqid = [Nypa].[GetMaxAccountSequenceId] (Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber,7), 
			AccountStatus = 'BC',
			AccountPreviousStatus = 'NB',
			AccountStatusCodePeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod 
		FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling INNER JOIN
			Billing.Account ON Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.UtilityCompanyId = Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider AND 
			Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber INNER JOIN
			Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
			Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
			Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.NextBillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
		WHERE Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y';

		-- Added on 12/14/2018 for UniqueAccountSeqID
        UPDATE Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling
		SET Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.UniqueAccountSeqid= Billing.Account.UniqueAccountSeqid
		FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling INNER JOIN Billing.Account on Billing.Account.AccountSeqID = Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.AccountSeqID 
		WHERE Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.UniqueAccountSeqid IS NULL;
			
		SET @BCAccountStatusUpdateCount = @@rowcount;

		-- Tag all of the account billing rows that were associated with an exchange record. If there was a new account the previous billing period is set to the current and revised billing period. This combination
		-- will help to determine when a new account enters into the system even though the '46' status code drops out in the next billing cycle.
		-- UploadNYPAExchangeData.CurrentAccountNumber exchanged accounts (AX or 46)
		UPDATE Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling
		SET PreviousBillingPeriod = dbo.CreateNewActivePreviousPeriod (Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod,@BillingCycle,ExchangeData.ExchangeCode), 
			ExhangeCode = ExchangeData.ExchangeCode,
			ExchangeEffectiveTransactionDate = ExchangeData.AccountEffectiveTurnOn,
			LastUpdate = getDate(),
			AuthenticatedUserID = @AuthenticatedUserID
		FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling INNER JOIN
			Common.ExchangeData ON 
			Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.CurrentAccountNumber;
			
		-- UploadNYPAExchangeData.OriginalAccountNumber exchanged accounts (AX)
		UPDATE Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling
		SET PreviousBillingPeriod = dbo.CreateNewActivePreviousPeriod (Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod,@BillingCycle,Common.ExchangeData.ExchangeCode), 
			ExhangeCode = Common.ExchangeData.ExchangeCode,
			ExchangeEffectiveTransactionDate = Common.ExchangeData.AccountEffectiveTurnOn,
			LastUpdate = getDate(),
			AuthenticatedUserID = @AuthenticatedUserID
		FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling INNER JOIN
			Common.ExchangeData ON Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.OriginalAccountNumber
		WHERE Common.ExchangeData.ExchangeCode = 'AX';
			
		-- Identifies all accounts that were billed in the current billing period
		-- It represents the orginal billed records recorded in the LastPeriodOriginalBilled column
		UPDATE Billing.Account
		SET LastPeriodOriginalBilled = Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod,
			LastUpdate = getDate(),
			AuthenticatedUserID = @AuthenticatedUserID
		FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling INNER JOIN
			Billing.Account ON Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
			Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.CurrentAccountNumber = Billing.Account.CurrentAccountNumber INNER JOIN
			Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
		WHERE Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y';
		
		-- Allocate the CustomerLevelAdjustments to the accounts
		EXEC [Nypa].[usp_ProRateCustomerLevelAdjustments] @StatusCode OUTPUT

		SET @StatusCode = 0;
	END;
END;
